headline: Southwest Airlines CFO Tammy Romo to Retire as Airline Embarks on Turnaround
summary: Romo is retiring after more than three decades with the carrier as it works on a turnaround after lagging behind some of its peers in recent years.

raw.headline: Southwest Airlines CFO Tammy Romo to Retire as Airline Embarks on Turnaround
raw.summary: Romo is retiring after more than three decades with the carrier as it works on a turnaround after lagging behind some of its peers in recent years.

headline: Southwest Airlines' CFO Tammy Romo to retire on April 1
summary: The Dallas-based carrier said it will begin a search for Romo's replacement.  Romo joined Southwest in 1991 and has held several leadership roles, including head of investor relations, controller, treasurer, and senior VP for planning.  Romo was added to the board of directors of Tenet Healthcare in 2015 in addition to working as chair of its audit committee.

headline: SOUTHWEST ANNOUNCES LEADERSHIP CHANGES
summary: Today two longtime Leaders at Southwest Airlines Co. (NYSE: LUV) announced plans to retire from their executive officer positions. Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer Tammy Romo and Chief Administration Officer Linda Rutherford will retire from their positions effective April 1, 2025.

headline: Airline Stock Roundup: RYAAY's Rosy Traffic Report, DAL in Focus & More
summary: RYAAY's December traffic impresses. JBLU incurs fine due to persistent flight delays.
